job_description:
Company Description

 

To assist the Indirect Tax compliance team in the ongoing management of client indirect tax reporting to the Australian Taxation Office (ATO). Key to your success in this role will be your ability to assist the team to provide accurate and timely support to our standardised and compliance-based services. You will develop relationships with clients, KPMG services teams and offshore partners, as well as act as a point of liaison with the ATO on behalf of the client.

 

Your Opportunity

 

  • Work as part of a dynamic team dealing with complex tax arrangements, and contribute to a range of complex client engagement activities
  • Deliver high quality, technically accurate outputs on a timely basis
  • Prepare, review and lodge activity statement for clients
  • Leverage KPMG tools and technology to provide value added services across a range of core services
  • Establish and support continuous improvement initiatives in compliance, accounting procedures and standard processing based activities
  • Seek out opportunities to ensure a full understanding of client on-boarding and risk procedures and contribute where appropriate
  • Actively build own capability to increase and diversify technical skills
  • Draft client advice for review, and applying your strong problem-solving skills, analytical skills and delivering actionable insights
  • Identifying emerging trends and best practices for our clients industry by monitoring economic, legislative, management and social forces in the national and global environment

 

How are you Extraordinary?

 

  • Working knowledge of GST legislation and strong understanding of reporting requirements
  • Experience in compliance and GST consulting desirable
  • Ability to navigate various systems, and a strong understanding of processes and controls that are relevant to the preparation of activity statements
  • Degree in tax, accounting, commerce or law
  • Experience in the tax, accounting or law fields
  • Willingly shares information and work with peers to streamline processes and create efficiencies
  • Strong problem-solving skills, analytical skills, and communication skills
  • Ability to deliver high quality, accurate outputs in an efficient manner
  • Identify issues and find solutions, communicate with team members and meet set KPI's

 

Additional Information

 

KPMG is a professional services firm with global outreach and deep sector experience. We work with clients across an array of industries to solve complex challenges, steer change and enable growth.

Our people are what make KPMG the thriving workplace that it is and what sets us apart is that we know great minds think differently. Collaborate with a team of passionate, highly skilled professionals who've got your back. You'll build relationships with unique and diverse colleagues who will provide you with the support you need to be your best and produce meaningful and impactful work in an inclusive, equitable culture.

At KPMG, you'll take control over how you work. We're embracing a new way of working in many ways, from offering flexible hours and locations to generous paid parental leave and career breaks. Our people enjoy a variety of exciting perks, including retail discounts, health and wellbeing initiatives, learning and growth opportunities, salary packaging options and more.

Diverse candidates have diverse needs. During your recruitment journey, information will be provided about adjustment requests. If you require additional support before submitting your application, please contact the Talent Attraction Support Team .

At KPMG every career is different, and we look forward to seeing how you grow with us.

Job Description

 

Associate Director - Mergers and Acquisitions (Natural Resources)

 

Deal Advisory, Perth

 

Our Perth Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A) team is experiencing strong deal flow and growth. To support this success and to continue our growth, there is a new opportunity for a high-performing, motivated individual to join the team, with a particular focus on natural resources and public market transactions.

 

KPMG advises and supports our ENR and Industrial sector clients (both domestic and international) across a range of transactions, including buy side, sell side, acquisitions, mergers, divestments, takeover response, and strategic equity capital raisings.

 

You will work closely with the national Head of Mining & Metals M&A, also based in Perth. This is a market facing role where you will play a key part in generating, evaluating, pitching, and executing high impact transactions, developing our team and its market opportunities.

 

KPMG's Deal Advisory practice is one of the largest nationally, closely connected to our international KPMG networks, allowing us to deliver cross border engagements for high-profile clients, both in the public and private markets.

 

Your opportunity - Associate Director

 

  • You will directly support and engage personally with a diverse range of clients.
  • From day one you will engage on live, interesting transactions with direct and consistent client interaction.
  • Be part of generating, analysing, structuring, and executing significant deal flow across growth sectors.
  • Opportunities and pathways for high quality professional development, advance to more senior roles and to widen the team offerings.
  • Be encouraged and supported to identify, investigate, and pursue business development opportunities.

 

How are you extraordinary?

 

At KPMG, we believe diversity of thought, background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients, and communities. Your skills and experience could include:

 

  • Recent and market proven Corporate Finance or M&A experience delivering transactions.
  • Exposure to Natural Resources sector is highly preferred.
  • Ability to work in a close-knit team environment and contribute to the team's culture and success.
  • Appetite to be first to market, developing deal flow and building your network to originate mandates.
  • Conviction to deliver complex opportunity assessments, due diligence, and execution across the full breadth of M&A deals.
  • Sound understanding of the market and economic trends, the issues impacting our clients and a voice in the market.
  • Ability to maintain high standards of professional and ethical conduct.

 

Additional Information

 

KPMG is a professional services firm with global outreach and deep sector experience. We work with clients across an array of industries to solve complex challenges, steer change and enable growth.

Our people are what make KPMG the thriving workplace that it is and what sets us apart is that we know great minds think differently. Collaborate with a team of passionate, highly skilled professionals who've got your back. You'll build relationships with unique and diverse colleagues who will provide you with the support you need to be your best and produce meaningful and impactful work in an inclusive, equitable culture.

At KPMG, you'll take control over how you work. We're embracing a new way of working in many ways, from offering flexible hours and locations to generous paid parental leave and career breaks. Our people enjoy a variety of exciting perks, including retail discounts, health and wellbeing initiatives, learning and growth opportunities, salary packaging options and more.

Diverse candidates have diverse needs. During your recruitment journey, information will be provided about adjustment requests. If you require additional support before submitting your application, please contact the Talent Attraction Support Team .

At KPMG every career is different, and we look forward to seeing how you grow with us.
job_title: Associate Director - Mergers and Acquisitions (Natural Resources)

job_description:
Job Description

 

Our Enterprise Technology Advisory team brings together skills in intelligent automation, data engineering and software integration to help our clients align their technology capabilities with their strategic and operational objectives. We also draw on KPMG's extensive national and global resources, adopting a multidisciplinary approach to help unlock the full potential of existing and new technology investments.

 

CC supports care and health providers, specifically in disability, aged care and community services. The software functions span customer management, workforce management, mobile care delivery and claims & payments with significant industry extensions to comply with quality standards and funding rules.

 

Your Opportunity

 

As a member of our Community Care team, the Technical Business Analyst will play a crucial role by:

 

  • Conduct end-to-end testing of Power Platform applications (including Power Automate workflows, Canvas Apps, and custom pages) to ensure solution stability, usability, and performance.
  • Develop and execute testing protocols, including regression testing, load testing, and user acceptance testing (UAT) tailored to Power Platform environments.
  • Document business workflows, technical specifications, and user guides across all components of the Power Platform to ensure accurate, up-to-date system documentation.
  • Support end-user training and onboarding efforts by contributing to knowledge bases, walkthroughs, and support materials.
  • Collaborate with project teams to understand business needs and ensure functionality aligns with real-world use cases.

 

How are you Extraordinary?

 

  • You are able to quickly build strong relationships and network with a variety of stakeholders both internal and external.
  • You are passionate about the importance of fantastic communication to share ideas, inspire, and create change. You are able to digest, distil, and communicate complex concepts in both written and verbal forms.

 

Your Experience

 

You thrive in a collaborative and innovative culture and want to join a firm that values problem solvers, the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and key stakeholders. We are looking for people in this role with a passion for and / or experience in the following areas:

 

  • Demonstrated experience in testing and documenting Power Platform applications, especially Power Apps, Power Automate, and custom pages.
  • Strong understanding of compliance, data governance, and real-world testing scenarios relevant to human services sectors.
  • Exceptional analytical thinking, attention to detail, and problem-solving abilities.
  • Excellent communication and technical writing skills - capable of producing clear, user-friendly documentation for both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Familiarity with tools such as DevOps, SharePoint, or Confluence is a plus.

 

Additional Information

 

KPMG is a professional services firm with global outreach and deep sector experience. We work with clients across an array of industries to solve complex challenges, steer change and enable growth.

Our people are what make KPMG the thriving workplace that it is and what sets us apart is that we know great minds think differently. Collaborate with a team of passionate, highly skilled professionals who've got your back. You'll build relationships with unique and diverse colleagues who will provide you with the support you need to be your best and produce meaningful and impactful work in an inclusive, equitable culture.

At KPMG, you'll take control over how you work. We're embracing a new way of working in many ways, from offering flexible hours and locations to generous paid parental leave and career breaks. Our people enjoy a variety of exciting perks, including retail discounts, health and wellbeing initiatives, learning and growth opportunities, salary packaging options and more.

Diverse candidates have diverse needs. During your recruitment journey, information will be provided about adjustment requests. If you require additional support before submitting your application, please contact the Talent Attraction Support Team .
